website_summaries.verdict: With room for 2 pans or a griddle, this larger portable stove provides plenty of cooking flexibility.
pros: Designed for 16-ounce propane bottles, but can attach larger ones using an adapter for more frequent use
Set up and clean up are easy
Users who have had this stove for years say it continues to work well
cons: Carrying bag and griddle don’t come with stove

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction
customer_reviews.text: The heat adjustment dials on the front fell off during first use. I found that the burners burned way too hot for use in normal (non-windy) weather conditions; it was difficult to get the heat level adjusted low enough to cook bacon and eggs without burning them. The rack is very loose and moves around.
customer_reviews.author: Karlye

customer_reviews.title: I hate trying to saute on it
customer_reviews.text: No ignitor. Will not cook at low temperatures. Very disappointing. I wish I could return it. I hate trying to saute on it.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Webber

customer_reviews.title: Great stove
customer_reviews.text: Very happy I got this stove. Used it for the first time tonight. It was a lot better than the cheaper "classic" stove. You really can't beat it for the price. I do wish it had an igniter, but not for the increased cost for using it a handful of times a year. Don't buy the propane from Amazon. Local stores carry them for $3-4 per bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kramp

customer_reviews.title: Must have for camping!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have item when going camping!! It makes frying so much easier than trying to maintain proper temps than using the grill or an open fire. Don't get me wrong, I love the grill when I camp and will NEVER not use a grill but there are some items that I would just reather use a frying pan and stove to cook on. Eggs for example are much better in the frying pan than on the grill. Using this stove with the Coleman griddle that is made specifically for it is the HOT ticket!! Get it? Hot? ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Toadster

customer_reviews.title: No Flame Control
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this grill because it was reasonably priced, has a good design, and is simple. However, I cannot recommend this grill due to its function. There is absolutely no flame control, your only options are to turn the burner on or off; there is no in-between. Further, the on/full takes longer to boil water than any of my MSR grills (Pocket rocket and WhisperLite). 1/10 would not recommend. Look at other models like CampChef.
customer_reviews.author: Eric E

customer_reviews.title: Quick setup, did it's job!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on a Friday for a last minute camping trip starting Saturday. Arrived as described before we left. Didnt open box until we got to our site. Took me 3 minutes to unbox, screw in the gas line (which was zip tied to the grill for shipping stability), then the small propane tank. Lit with the first touch of lighter flame. Provided us with fresh perked coffee all trip. Easy to put up, easy to clean and store away again. Absolutely NO complaints. Glad I didn't experience any of the negative things other reviewers did, I almost did not buy it because of them.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia M.

customer_reviews.title: Just right for the job
customer_reviews.text: Just used this for the first time on a weekend camping trip. Easy to set up, lights easily and burns hot. It was kind of a windy day, but it didn't affect making coffee in a percolator. My previous butane stove had problems in any kind of wind, but not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K

customer_reviews.title: What you’d expect from a Coleman product, in a good way.
customer_reviews.text: A bombproof camp stove. It’s simple to setup and use, and there’s not much on it that could break making it a typical long-lasting Coleman product. It’s not super light, however when you’re using these types of stoves, weight normally isn’t a big concern. My only complaint is that this doesn’t have an ignition switch, it’s not a deal breaker but that definitely makes it convenient. Anyways, I love this stove, every once in a while wipe it down thoroughly with some simple green or other degreaser and this thing will last you a good while!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: I bought a stove a just over a month ago on Amazon and took it on a camping trip without testing it before the trip. The regulator would not correctly seat with the stove and I could not get gas to come out after working an hour in it with a flashlight in the dark with mosquitos biting me. If I wiggle the regulator I can get a little gas to come out but not like it should. I have been using camp stoves since I was a kid so I know how to connect them. The gas bottle was full.
customer_reviews.author: OCPlanner

customer_reviews.title: Overall construction is pretty solid for price but the adjustment valves are very ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall construction is pretty solid for price but the adjustment valves are very difficult to control. It takes a lot of patience to get the flame adjusted and there really is no simmer capability
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great camping stove.
customer_reviews.text: This Coleman Triton stove is amazing. It doesn't have the built-in ignition feature (you will have to splurge for the + version) so we just used our multi-purpose lighter to ignite the burners instead. We used it to cook for a 4-day camping trip and it never let us down. There's a couple of youtube videos that show you how to tweak the burner output so you can basically have better control of the flame. I highly recommend doing the tweak so you don't overheat your food.
customer_reviews.author: Rich T.

customer_reviews.title: One of the best stoves.
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few different types of stoves, from different manufacturers over the decades. But, my last Coleman 2-burner stove like this one, lasted the longest (16-18yrs). Even after using it countless times at the beach or on the boat. Not a big fan of the solid "tank-to-stove" regulator system (my last one had the hose factory attached to the stove...only had to screw on the propane tank). But, so far so good. Good idea to store the regulator in a towel or something, to keep dust out of the orifices and to keep it from scratching up the stoves finish...if you're flying down a graded gravel road of on a bouncy boat.
customer_reviews.author: YesSir

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an impromptu family camping trip. 2 weeks, 5000+ miles and 6 national parks I'd say we put this to the test and I'm happy to report it worked as well as I'd hoped. I wish there was a better way to stow the tank attachment thingy, I wrapped mine in hand towel to stop if from rattling around. Would definitely but it again.
customer_reviews.author: keithlevine

customer_reviews.title: great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a camping/portable stove. I wouldn't consider cooking a gourmet meal in the typical breeze/bright conditions of an afternoon lakeside. The flame can be challenging to see in bright conditions, but I find the SOUND of the fuel burning seems to do the trick for me. As my wife likes to tell me: 'propane burns hot.' With my camping cookware not the same weight as home, I can see that connection. Still, I've been able to get great fish recipes out. Burgers come out great. Chicken requires a little more time and attention in a covered pot. I think this is a great solution to camping stoves -- especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Escamilla

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working after One Month
customer_reviews.text: This was a great product while it lasted. Very easy to set up and cook with. Like many have mentioned, the knobs are very sensitive and the heat produced is very hot. Unfortunately, after about a month of use, the left burner went on the fritz. The left burner continuously released propane even when the the knob is turned off. I basically need to unscrew the propane tank to turn if off. Very disappointing. I will be asking for a replacement or a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Geewizz29

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camping
customer_reviews.text: I use this for camping with a small propane tank. It heats up my cast iron in minutes! The side flaps help prevent the wind from blowing out the flame. And once it's off it takes a short time to cool down before storing. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Burner issue
customer_reviews.text: I have only used the stove once, but I quickly had an issue with the left side burner. While the right one workes just fine, the left one seems to go from off to the highest setting - nothing in between. It was difficult to cook on the burner unless I wanted high heat, such as to heat a kettle of water. Unfortunately I no longer have the box and I'm outside the return period. I believe I saw in someone else's comments some ways to fix this, it's just frustrating that it didn't work the correct way right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived defective. Didn’t discover this until we made camp in 25* weather with a foot of snow on the ground. Luckily I brought charcoal as a back up. Tried it 20 different times and followed the Coleman troubleshooting recommendations and tried multiple fuel canisters. No fuel ever made it to the burners. Sent it back today immediately when we got back into town. Now I’m looking for something other than a Coleman.
customer_reviews.author: mimthedwarf

customer_reviews.title: A well proven stove
customer_reviews.text: This is Coleman so been around for years and shows the fact that it has endured because it's good. Simple enough design, that it's not complicated to set up and get right to cooking. It folds down and latches closed for travel, and is compact. It's a camp stove so 2 burners are enough for me, coffee and bacon and eggs! soup and boiled water ! and whatever goes with bar-b-que'd campfire food!
customer_reviews.author: neilbcca

customer_reviews.title: No instant start, nice stove
customer_reviews.text: Transition from Coleman white gas stove to propane canister product has been easy and a clear step up. Easy to clean and set up. Our stove does not have the instant light nor did I want it but the description does read that it has. Thanks to other reviewers, I knew what I was getting. There is room inside the closed stove to carry a propane lighter. Low level burning is a challenge to dial to so it may not get as low as I may want. We have used it on several extended camping trips and it has held up, closure is solid.
customer_reviews.author: gfh GA

customer_reviews.title: Functional and affordable.
customer_reviews.text: This product may not be the fanciest stove out there but it definitely gets the most bang for buck. It works just like it’s supposed to. We used it most recently for a multi day camping trip in the upper peninsula of Michigan. It did a great job for us and we found the space was big enough for a couple decent sized pans. The flame control was also good and we were able to quickly bring a pot to full boil as well as simmer. If you’re looking for a no frills functional stove that won’t break the bank you can’t do better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Tree

customer_reviews.title: Not a big fan, adjustments limited
customer_reviews.text: While I like the size, the heat controls are limited and there is no starter. Cooks way too hot and the knob control is terrible, trying to cook on low blows out flame even without much wind. Wish I would have bought something else but will live with it. This is like my 5th Coleman stove over the years and it is a downgrade from all other stoves with the exception over size and portability.
customer_reviews.author: BeHappy

customer_reviews.title: Great Value but basically just two settings - high or off
customer_reviews.text: I really love this stove for camping. It made everything so much easier. The wind guard and everything worked great. The only complaint I have is that the stove has two settings high and off. But in the woods, I couldn't have been happier. It took a long time for my friends to boil water on the fire but it took me I think 3 minutes lol. Great stove. Easy to set up. Easy to use. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Sami

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: I needed a stove that was under 21” wide and 5” in height and this stove fit my space limitations. The price is great and it works great too, really strong flame for what I use the stove for. I think it’s a little cheaply constructed, I’m not crazy about the lid, the latch or the wind screens, but I guess they work as long as you dont treat it poorly. The one thing I hate about the stove is there is no insta-start button to light the burner. Other than that it is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Geisterbild

customer_reviews.title: Good camping (not backpacking) stove
customer_reviews.text: Great for camping when you don't want to cook everything over the campfire. Definitely not for backpacking. You can also purchase a converter to hook up a 5 gallon propane tank (more economical than buying those tiny green tanks). I am using non-stick aluminum pans and this stove heats up fast (perfect for those camping meals that require only boiling water).
customer_reviews.author: JC Hertzler

customer_reviews.title: NO IGNITER BUTTON!
customer_reviews.text: I returned this once, thinking it may have been packaged incorrectly. Nope, after a series of these stoves being sent to my house, none of them had the igniter button as shown in the description. Disappointed. Better options are out there!
customer_reviews.author: Np

customer_reviews.title: Poor flame control
customer_reviews.text: Was very surprised for a product by Colmon to have some major flaws: first off, the control knobs might as well be on/off switches. Although they are variable ;they seem to have no effect on flame adjustment. Second when folded up the regulator gets loosely stowed between the burners. It as well as stove grating are fit very loosely becoming a giant rattle as you transport.
customer_reviews.author: HILL BILLY

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping or catering
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great!! I use it when camping and don't feel like setting up a fire each time I want to cook. Super easy and quick setup. Wish I got the one with the igniter (didn't even know that was an option). Very easy to control the temperature. I've cooked on this with cast irons and large pots. I highly recommend. Also great for chefs as I have a catering business where I sometimes need a cooking station. Much easier to have than the standard single burners since this is nice and compact but can accommodate 2 12" pans with ease
customer_reviews.author: Remus Turnier

customer_reviews.title: Great at boiling water...thats pretty much it.
customer_reviews.text: If you are thinking you can cook on this, think again. If you are simply looking to boil water, great. Otherwise, there are two settings on this: off, and surface of the sun. Immediately it will burn the food/sauce/anything to the bottom of the pan/pot/utensil you are using, regardless of how quality the thing is (we used camping specific and non camping specific pots and pans to no avail). If you are getting this to cook, which i figure most are, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: N. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: It does not have an ignitor
customer_reviews.text: If I had realized it did not have an ignitor I would not have purchased this stove, but it is not clearly stated anywhere. It's hard to fathom why that is not standard these days, it is almost unsafe trying to use a lighter stick which tend to go out while trying to ignite, and what happens if it runs out or you lose it on a trip. But I had to use it, so I'm assuming I can't return it, so feel stuck with it now. It should be clearly stated, there is not one reference to how to light it on the box.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Most Excellent Camp Stove
customer_reviews.text: The Coleman Triton is lightweight, very simple to set up, and easy to use. The camp stove is convenient for camping and following the downtime of power due to storms. The two-burner system throws an even flame. The dials are smooth and a little sensitive. I was able to boil water, scramble eggs, and fry two patties of hamburger meat within a few minutes. The assembly and disassembly are simple and easy. I would suggest spending the extra money for the igniter.
customer_reviews.author: david a yarborough

customer_reviews.title: Great car camping stove
customer_reviews.text: Great car camping stove. More burner adjustment than the older style Colman green stove so it is easier to cook stuff on low heat or if you need to crank it up really hot
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Used it twice and it's already broken
customer_reviews.text: We received this in March and used it once, we brought it out camping for the second time this past weekend and it was already broken. The propane connection wouldn't work, seems like this is a common issue with these, too late to return, so now we just have a piece of junk. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney L Allen

customer_reviews.title: Not Your Dad's Coleman
customer_reviews.text: Overall it wouldn't have been a bad stove IF the burner controls worked well. It was impossible to get a low heat setting. Returned. Once upon a time 'Coleman' was all you needed to know about camping gear. It was made in Wichita, Kansas, USA! Now it comes from China.
customer_reviews.author: James T. Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Works well! Awesome camping stove!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Coleman camp stove. The side panels help protect the flame from the elements for outside cooking. On bigger campouts, I run an adapter to screw it into a 5-gallon propane tank. It puts out great heat, cleans up easy, folds up for easy transport. For breakfast, I use a skillet over both burners for bacon and pancakes. A little pricey (unless you find a deal somewhere), but totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Living the dream!

customer_reviews.title: ARRIVED ON TIME!
customer_reviews.text: I still haven't used the stove, because I didn't have access to Internet where I live here in Puerto Rico! ,so I found the box today! This, for me, is the greatest gift received so far. Not having any electricity since Hurricane Maria, and surviving with a single burner connected to the gas, this is absolutely great, and, most of all, it arrived safe, and, ON TIME! thanks to UPS. USPS here has failed greatly, as have practically all the systems here, so waiting for them to deliver is an additional hassle we have to endure. As soon as I use it, I will surely write my impression, when I have Internet again.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam Marti

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping
customer_reviews.text: This item was great. no complaints at all. the griddle that is suggested to purchase separately is terrible though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this Stove
customer_reviews.text: I just received the Coleman Triton LGP stove today to replace the wonderful liquid Coleman fuel camp stove I've had for 30 years (which still works great.) I just wanted the convenience of screwing in a canister. I connected the stove to a 1 lb canister of Propane and lit both burners. They fired right up! Like other reviews said, there really is no low/simmer stage of the burner. It has only 2 levels, high or very high. But I'm okay with that. This stove is exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: LittleCrow

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stove based on previous experience with Coleman stoves. I purchased it the end of the season 2018. We attempted to use it for the time last week. It does not work. Too late to return, now I have a new non working stove and am out 65.00.
customer_reviews.author: Marrion

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Stove in every regard - except for simmer
customer_reviews.text: I use this stove to fix roadside meals on long drives, as well as on the sailboat I live on. It is durable, efficient, easy to clean, relatively wind resistant, lightweight, portable, and just dang handy. My only gripe is the simmer. In one quarter-turn of the dial, the stove is on full blast. Which means the simmer range is within the quarter-turn between Off and Fully Open. But simmering is possible, and works well. It's just a challenge to get the perfect level.
customer_reviews.author: Cary Gavin

customer_reviews.title: Misleading pictures! No Ignitor!!!
customer_reviews.text: This model does not have the insta start button as pictured in the "From the Manufacturer" section!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra D.

customer_reviews.title: Best RV stove
customer_reviews.text: We bought it for use during our RV camping trips. We'd been using a Weber Q for all outdoor cooking, but this gave us a lot more versatility and I've actually started setting up both the grill and stove at the same time to cook and fry or boil at the same time, which allows us to have "home" quality meals at campgrounds. Heats up in an instant. We love it
customer_reviews.author: Craig C.

customer_reviews.title: Solid purchase for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this camp stove. We used this several times over a 5 day (very rainy) camping trip and had no problems. I did dock 1 star because the difference between just barely on and full blast is negligible so it does run pretty darn high even at the lowest setting we could have it at without the flame going out. Otherwise, totally satisfied with this stove.
customer_reviews.author: OhKFish

customer_reviews.title: Great camp stove
customer_reviews.text: We used this on our most recent camping trip and it worked great to cook for our family of 5. It's easy to set up, turn on, and it cooks evenly and quickly. I was impressed how quickly it boiled water for our coffee too. I'd definitely recommend this camping stove!
customer_reviews.author: Mattfswife

customer_reviews.title: Great Camping Stove
customer_reviews.text: This stove is a great addition to our car camping gear. Easy to set up and light. The burners are very sensitive so a minute turn of the knob is all you need to adjust the flame size. We purchased a cast iron griddle to use with the stove and it works great, but keep in mind that the middle section doesn't heat/cook as well as the areas directly over the burners when using the griddle.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Willman

customer_reviews.title: Great stove
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for my camping trip in the grand canyon. Neither my boyfriend or myself had ever used a camp stove before but we figured it out really easily and we both used it. I bought the little Coleman propane tanks you can get for super cheap at the grocery store. The wind guards worked really since it's very windy at the grand canyon.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Works very well and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: The fuel line should snap into something: a bracket or holder of some sort instead of just sitting in the tray. Levelling feet would be helpful to deal with uneven picnic tables. Other than that, it's been very reliable and comes apart easily to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Pubb

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need it to
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough, but the knobs do not control the flame level very well. It’s pretty much on or off. Can get it to be a slightly smaller flame, but it isn’t anything like a kitchen stove with high, medium, low, and simmer. Attaching the propane is easy. Wind guards are helpful. I’m sure it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Billmakesmovies

customer_reviews.title: it cooks ok and is compact and easy to transport
customer_reviews.text: I should have paid closer attention when ordering. There is no ignitor button so it's manual light. I thought this would be a step up from the basic Coleman stove but it's really not. The gas control knobs are very touchy and difficult to regulate. Overall,. it cooks ok and is compact and easy to transport. Not terrible, but would probably get a more expensive model next time
customer_reviews.author: Donna B

customer_reviews.title: gas stove
customer_reviews.text: love this camp stove... why the 4 stars? it seems the stove uses gas a lot faster than reo\ported. wonder if it leaks? we love to cook outdoors even though we have an RV. ... would love to hear from the mfg about gas usagage.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: This is not an instant start stove.
customer_reviews.text: I paid extra for this stove based on the description that it was an instant start. This is not an instant start stove, so I think there was some deception in the advertising. Consumers should not have to understand the manufacturers product coding to know what they are buying. The stove itself works great and I would be happy with it if I didn't pay extra for the instant start. I'm just hugely disappointed with Amazon for allowing for this kind of deceptive advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No ignition switch.
customer_reviews.text: It stated it had an ignition switch......well it doesn’t. I bought it a few mo this ago went camping this past week and had to use a lighter. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Simply the BEST
customer_reviews.text: Are you kidding me?! Ohhh, right...not everyone knows this stove is a camping icon for a reason. It has been virtually unchanged for decades because Coleman achieved design perfection from the start. Buy this, a percolating coffee pot and a griddle that spans both burners—go camping!
customer_reviews.author: COLDESU

customer_reviews.title: Brand new and did not work from day 1
customer_reviews.text: Got as a gift for Christmas for use on trip to the FL Keys. Looked good like all other Coleman things I have owned through the years. 1500 miles away from home first use, or shall I say first attempt at use resulting in NO flame. Stove does not work, will not light so no way to cook at our campsite. Had to go buy a new stove. Surprised (and pissed) as I own many other Coleman things and have used Coleman stuff for years camping. Amazon says window for return is “closed”
customer_reviews.author: Thomas B.

customer_reviews.title: Decent camp stove at a low price
customer_reviews.text: This Coleman Triton is a decent no-frills stove that will cook your food hot and fast. However, there is almost no temperature control on either burner. They essentially have two settings "afterburner" and "off". I found myself turning the burner off and relighting several times when I was cooking as to not scorch everything. Its manageable but kind of a pain. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Jones

customer_reviews.title: This time is pretty awesome. Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This time is pretty awesome. Easy to set up. It gets really really hot, I never once thought it would have a problem cooking something. Fairly lightweight, you still want it to be durable. I wish the little knobs had a clear cut arrow or something on it saying which was on, but not a big deal at all. Im excited to use a griddle on it next!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I like this one. It's temp control is good but getting it to a very low simmer is touchy. Lots of good heat on the higher settings. I actually like that it does NOT have the electric push lighter because those things never last.
customer_reviews.author: Topher

customer_reviews.title: Another great Coleman product.
customer_reviews.text: Another great product from Coleman. I bought it primarily because the grates appeared to be heavy duty, which they are. The controls also allow for a bit more low heat control than other stoves I've used. All in all a great product. I gave 4 stars instead of 5 because the handle is just slightly awkward and the control knobs are exposed when the stove is closed, which increases the chance of breaking them during transit.
customer_reviews.author: Cary S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stove
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about flame adjustability based on some comments. This stove has excellent flame adjustability. This is the Triton stove without the auto lighter. You will need a match or lighter to light this stove. And that is exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: A. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Very good. Has the classic basic design with compact briefcase-style ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good. Has the classic basic design with compact briefcase-style when closed. I might have gotten the next level up with the push button start had I known about it.
customer_reviews.author: Cinemod

customer_reviews.title: Ease of set up. Boils water fast
customer_reviews.text: A quality made stove. Easy to use a real powerful gas stove . A quarter turn of the knob is all you need. Burners are excellent. Plenty of power and heat at a 1/4 turn. Can't imagine opening burners all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Felix Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and break down for your outdoor cooking needs!
customer_reviews.text: Coleman has been around for over 100 years for a reason. They make a quality product. Their stoves are famous for camping trips. This is the reason I thought it was time to replace my mother-in-law's Coleman Stove that ran on camp fuel. It basically annoyed me so much that I had to pump oxygen into the camp fuel tank to make it light, that I just decided to buy another stove. While the old Coleman still works great, I like the propane tank set up due to how easy it is to use. Plus it's lighter and less rigid. Great product for a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: J.P. S

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Easy to use and setup. Its pretty slim so I can store it most places. Only one issue. The knob for gas/heat adjustment seems to always be at high. If its on low, its feels high. and when its on high, its too high. Not sure why but that doesnt really bug me since I dont care about the temp of which I cook.
customer_reviews.author: Lucio Duran

customer_reviews.title: To.much power
customer_reviews.text: I love it but it has a huge problem if you want to travel countrys like peru or chile. If you use a big tank Regulators there dont give you the presion enough for this stove. It needs alot.
customer_reviews.author: Ajh

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Stove
customer_reviews.text: Boy you really have to watch how much you turn on the fire. Because this stove can really heat up very quickly. Other than that this is a very good product for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Clunky

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you carry a lighter or matches
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Just beware that this model does not have the electrical ignition so make sure you have a lighter or matches to ignite. Plenty of BTUs and is very efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Nice stove, the quality that one would expect from ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice stove, the quality that one would expect from Coleman. My one complaint is that when I bought it the product listing made it appear that it came with a griddle but it did not. I saw afterward that the griddle was optional.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bibber

customer_reviews.title: What a thing of beauty
customer_reviews.text: After using a single burner for a while I had to upgrade. This thing is so nice I don't even want to use a real stove ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Don, The

customer_reviews.title: Serves the purpose
customer_reviews.text: Has met my needs during several extended power outages. Boil water for instant coffee and heat up cans of stew and other small dishes...not much else - a true vacation camper stove. Be advised that the 16oz bottles are expensive and go quickly.
customer_reviews.author: mp mcgrath

customer_reviews.title: Product doesn’t work. Support is abusive and no help at all!
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box the product does not work! The live chat support is abusive and hung up on me, after promising to help and asking me several questions and miss spelling my name several times. The 800 number for Support hung up on me over a dozen times without connecting me to an agent. The one time it did connect me with an agent, the agent hung up on me! I guess once you get a customers money, you just have fun abusing them and making sure that they paid for nothing!
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Great value stove
customer_reviews.text: This was my first stove purchase. My girlfriend and I cooked breakfast and dinner with it on a recent camping trip and it was perfect. Very easy to use. Awesome value.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: no camp chef is complete without this stove
customer_reviews.text: works great! excellent adjustment on the burner temp, easy to clean, reliable. When I camp, I like to eat better than when I eat at home. Bacon, potatoes, eggs in the morning and seafood linguini with mushrooms for dinner type of cooking. This stove works great for the camp chef. I would recommend this to anybody looking at eating right while out in the woods!
customer_reviews.author: chris vair

customer_reviews.title: Should have paid like $35
customer_reviews.text: Requires use of a lighter, doesn't have a spark switch. The latch is crooked and takes serious muscle to open or close, but I've used it a lot and it hasn't broken. I paid $65. Should have paid like $35
customer_reviews.author: Brandess Sorrels

customer_reviews.title: Life savor.
customer_reviews.text: This stove is super light weight, but sturdy. Super easy to use and gets super hot.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen Smith

customer_reviews.title: Boils great.
customer_reviews.text: Works great if you want to boil things. Like most stoves, it does not turn down to low very easily. When I turn it down, it usually goes out, then I have to relight. This was highly rated so I thought it would be better. A bit disappointed. [I am not a paid reviewer]
customer_reviews.author: todd & kate

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware: No Insta-Start button. This requires a lighter or match to start!
customer_reviews.text: Under “about this item, from the manufacturer section” it clearly shows a picture of a red button with insta start and matchless ignition. This camp stove DOES NOT HAVE THIS BUTTON!!! I wish I would have read the reviews. Other consumers have pointed this out for several years now. Shame on Amazon for not correcting this!! I’m contemplating returning this to get the one with the ignition starter.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas P Salonis

customer_reviews.title: Can't control flame intensity
customer_reviews.text: Like others have stated, it's either on or off. Theres no way to control the flame intensity if you need to cook something on a lower heat.
customer_reviews.author: Psycraft

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase and burner controls operate as advertised
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because it advertised as being able to adjust flame to very low levels and it lives up to the claim. This Triton stove replace a previous, less expensive Coleman that burned a flame very high or out completely.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Kueffler

customer_reviews.title: JUNK!!!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this camp stove May 20th 2019. By October, it no longer worked. We only used it about a half dozen times.
customer_reviews.author: Nina H.

customer_reviews.title: Hot
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use stove. Heats stuff up very quickly. Used for camping in Yellowstone. Made several meals withour issue!
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I bought the identical one last year and returned jt after one use. It would not heat up. But this one works extremely well per the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but...
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this products works well, except that it's SUPER hard to adjust the flame. it's either full blast, or off. You need to have super ninja like skills to dial it down.
customer_reviews.author: Laurajean Rispens

customer_reviews.title: Looks like it can take some abuse
customer_reviews.text: Nothing beats some eggs and bacon in the morning during a camping trip. Runs with the small propane tanks. No electric starter :( It does heat fast and well. Looks like it can take some abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel W.

customer_reviews.title: A quality replacement for the original Coleman
customer_reviews.text: This obviously isn't an original Coleman, but it's the next-best option. Solid construction and easy assembly. I'm looking forward to using this stove for many years to come. The only thing that should be added is an ignitor, but that's not something that should decrease the number of stars in this review.
customer_reviews.author: coloradonative

customer_reviews.title: Great burner
customer_reviews.text: This worked great on a few of my camping trips, easy to clean as well. The control knobs work great which made cooking easy.
customer_reviews.author: Kerviews

customer_reviews.title: Runs hot
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Only complaint is that it runs quite hot but is rather difficult to turn it down real low as it starts to extinguish itself.
customer_reviews.author: HJL

customer_reviews.title: My Grandma had one!
customer_reviews.text: We called her old Betsy then, and I named mine the same name. It's like having my Grandmother with me on camping trips. It's a bit of nostalgia that produces the most fond memories of recipes shared through generations. It performs just as flawlessly as the old one did.
customer_reviews.author: Noena808

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camp Stove!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to set up and use. Runs on a small green bottle of propane. Very pleased with purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Susan O.

customer_reviews.title: Best little camp stove
customer_reviews.text: I thoroughly enjoyed this stove on our camping trip in the woods of Colorado. I had some of the best steaks of my life cooked on this stove. It has a nice amount of surface space and it heats evenly across. It is easy to clean and easy to store. I would recommend this camp stove to anyone looking for a nice quality stove that is durable and has the right price.
customer_reviews.author: Janel M.

customer_reviews.title: Love this stove
customer_reviews.text: To the point.... Not having the button ignitor is way better than having it. Just a flick of a lighter and your in business. The simplicity of this stove wins the day here in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Dinojas

customer_reviews.title: Evenly means even cook
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my camping trip and the gas was delivered evenly and consistent. I made a gourmet meal and it delivered.
customer_reviews.author: DonnaC

customer_reviews.title: Used, like new, worth it 👍🏼👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: Although it is used, it is in perfect condition. Lightweight, good material and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ela Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Cannot Open Latch
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this stove last year and ready to head out camping and find that I cannot open it. I have tried pulling latch out at bottom and lifting as instructed, but its as solid as a rock and wont move. I've given up. Any suggestions short of throwing it in trash?
customer_reviews.author: Oregonaussie

customer_reviews.title: I really like the construction, everthy seems very straight forward.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike, I've not had to use it yet, being here in Florida, thank God!
customer_reviews.author: P. L. Townsend

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! So easy to assemble, store and use. Love it. Took it camping for 2 weeks up north and worked great every day!
customer_reviews.author: coredelia8

customer_reviews.title: I haven't use yet
customer_reviews.text: It was purchased due to the pending storm we had heading our way. I grew up with Coleman products and my dad owned one decades ago. I have it for power outage emergencies at this time. Maybe some day, may go camping.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M Corbin

customer_reviews.title: great for camping
customer_reviews.text: I've gone on two 4-night camping trips since I purchased this stove and have been quite happy with it's simplicity and operation. From fresh morning coffee, cooked-from-scratch meals and heating up leftovers and prepared meals it has worked great. I don't need to drag a gourmet kitchen into the woods with me. Keep it simple is how I like to camp. And the price was right!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth I.

customer_reviews.title: Grill/Griddle not included
customer_reviews.text: Stove is very nice and works great. Do have to turn the knobs a lot before it will light. Picture and wording to me was misleading as it shows the griddle with the stove and the description says grill. Found out after we received the stove that the griddle/grill is sold separately.
customer_reviews.author: Jayne Ellen Mourning

customer_reviews.title: Stove came with rust out of the box
customer_reviews.text: My stove came with rust on it. Not sure how that would happen but for a brand new stove that’s disappointing from coleman
customer_reviews.author: Abe B.

customer_reviews.title: Regulators are not easy to work with.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to open and close. Regulators are hard to adjust to lower flame.
customer_reviews.author: E.Bentz

product_meta.title: Coleman Triton 2 Burner Propane Portable Tabletop Camping Stove Cooking Grill
product_meta.description: Take camp cooking to the next level with the Coleman Triton Propane Stove. Just light it up and dial in your heat with the two independently adjustable burners and you can be cooking over 22,000 BTUs of power in no time. The cooking surface offers plenty of room to fit a 12-in. and 10-in. pan simultaneously. Meanwhile, the PerfectFlow pressure control technology keeps the heat steady, even in extreme conditions. WindBlock panels help shield your flame from wind, and they adjust if you need to fit a larger pan. When the meal is over, the chrome-plated grate removes for simple and quick cleanup, and the heavy-duty latch will keep the lid secure until you whip up your next family dinner.
feature_bullets: Wind Block panels help shield burners from wind and adjust for various pan sizes
PerfectFlow technology provides consistent performance, even in extreme conditions
PerfectHeat technology for more efficient cooking with less fuel
Large enough for one 12 and one 10 Inches pans plus room to stow the griddle
